page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Employment in the village is found in agriculture, racing stables, shop, a guest house, welding, furniture restoration and freelance floristry, the last three being self-employment only. Employment in the shop is part-time and one or two ladies are employed part-time as domestics in the village. The workforce in the area is very small, numbering only forty. Of these only twelve are employed in the village and the rest go to London, Salisbury, Bristol, Warminster or very locally to Dan Maid Seafoods Ltd. One or two are in Her Majesty's Services at nearby R.A.F. or Army bases and one villager is in the Royal Navy. The choice of livelihood is varied; as well as the Armed Forces, the law, entertainment, building, engineering and office work provide employment outside the area.
